meanings.definition: A person or machine that stamps.
meanings.sent1: The stampers at the post office work quickly to put the date on letters.
meanings.sent2: I bought a set of colorful stampers to decorate my scrapbook.
meanings.sent3: The stampers in the factory had a stamping contest to see who could stamp the most papers in one minute.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like stampers, leaving a lasting impression on everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The stampers in the library were so loud that they could be heard from across the room.

meanings.sent1: My mom uses a stamper to mark our address on envelopes.
meanings.sent2: The metal stamper made a clear imprint on the paper.
meanings.sent3: The stamper in my desk drawer always gets stuck when I try to use it.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a stamper, leaving a permanent mark on my heart.
meanings.sent5: The stamper in the office is so old that it leaves a faded mark on documents.

meanings.definition: A device for impressing a design or mark.
meanings.sent1: The stamper on the teacher's desk had a smiley face design.
meanings.sent2: I used a stamper to put my initials on the book.
meanings.sent3: The stamper at the craft store had a unicorn design that kids loved.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a stamper, leaving joy wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The stamper in the art class had intricate patterns that could create beautiful designs.
